page.title: 02Landscape-Physical
page.content: The highest point in the block is DECHMONT HILL at 183m.At it's lowest, the surface falls below 30m.at a point where the Rotten Calder leaves the north east corner of the block.The southern portion is an open landscape and undulates between 152m.and 76m. From DECHMONT HILL the land slopes downwards towards the River Clyde to the north.From this high ground there are magnificent views over Glasgow to the Campsie Fells and the Scottish Highlands beyond . Along the eastern edge of the block the Rotten Calder has cut into the surface.The wooded banks of the river provide many local beauty spots.
